verbose_text: Importantly, clinical symptoms of thyroid dysfunction, such as fatigue and constipation, overlap with side effects of lenalidomide, making a diagnosis of hypothyroidism challenging in these patients.2, 4 Therefore, measurement of the TSH level before lenalidomide initiation and every 2-3 months while on treatment has been suggested.4 In conclusion, we report a case of lenalidomide induced severe hypothyroidism resulting in rhabdomyolysis and AKI in a patient with MM.
